cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, forecast to turn NW then N-NW across central/western Cuba Monday and track northward just offshore or along Florida’s west coast toward the Tampa Bay area Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near or just south of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: No Florida coastal warnings in effect as of Advisory 14A
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward to the Big Bend lies within the 5-day forecast cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (40-60 mph gusts) possible at the port beginning late Monday night or Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft possible along the immediate Tampa Bay coastline depending on track and tide timing
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with isolated totals up to 6 inches, producing localized flash and urban flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands possible
